trans-unit.source: Enable remote desktop for cloud services (Node.js)
trans-unit.target: Enable remote desktop for cloud services (Node.js)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to enable remote-desktop access for the virtual machines hosting your Azure Node.js application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to enable remote-desktop access for the virtual machines hosting your Azure Node.js application.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Remote Desktop in Azure
trans-unit.target: Enabling Remote Desktop in Azure

trans-unit.source: Remote Desktop enables you to access the desktop of a role instance
trans-unit.target: Remote Desktop enables you to access the desktop of a role instance

trans-unit.source: running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can use a remote desktop connection to
trans-unit.target: You can use a remote desktop connection to

trans-unit.source: configure the virtual machine or troubleshoot problems with your
trans-unit.target: configure the virtual machine or troubleshoot problems with your

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: This article applies to Node.js applications hosted as an Azure Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: This article applies to Node.js applications hosted as an Azure Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a Node.js app to an Azure Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: Deploy a Node.js app to an Azure Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Build and deploy a Node.js application to an Azure Cloud Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Build and deploy a Node.js application to an Azure Cloud Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Use Azure PowerShell to configure the service for Remote Desktop access
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Use Azure PowerShell to configure the service for Remote Desktop access

trans-unit.source: To use Remote Desktop, you need to update the Azure service definition and
trans-unit.target: To use Remote Desktop, you need to update the Azure service definition and

trans-unit.source: configuration with a username, password, and certificate.
trans-unit.target: configuration with a username, password, and certificate.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps from a computer that contains the source files for your app.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps from a computer that contains the source files for your app.

trans-unit.source: Run Azure PowerShell as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Run Azure PowerShell as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: (From the Start Menu or Start Screen, search for Azure PowerShell.)
trans-unit.target: (From the Start Menu or Start Screen, search for Azure PowerShell.)

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the directory that contains the service definition (.csdef) and
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the directory that contains the service definition (.csdef) and

trans-unit.source: service configuration (.cscfg) files.
trans-unit.target: service configuration (.cscfg) files.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: At the prompt, enter a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: At the prompt, enter a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>enable-azureserviceprojectremotedesktop</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>enable-azureserviceprojectremotedesktop</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet to publish the changes:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet to publish the changes:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>publish-azureserviceproject</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>publish-azureserviceproject</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Connect to the role instance
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Connect to the role instance

trans-unit.source: After you publish the update service definition, you can connect to
trans-unit.target: After you publish the update service definition, you can connect to

trans-unit.source: the role instance.
trans-unit.target: the role instance.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal], select Cloud Services and then select your service.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal], select Cloud Services and then select your service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>azure management portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>azure management portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Instances, and then click Production or Staging to see the instances for your service.
trans-unit.target: Click Instances, and then click Production or Staging to see the instances for your service.

trans-unit.source: Select an instance and then click Connect at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select an instance and then click Connect at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The instances page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The instances page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you click Connect, the web browser prompts you to save an
trans-unit.target: When you click Connect, the web browser prompts you to save an

trans-unit.source: .rdp file.
trans-unit.target: .rdp file.

trans-unit.source: Open this file.
trans-unit.target: Open this file.

trans-unit.source: (For example, if you're using Internet Explorer, click Open.)
trans-unit.target: (For example, if you're using Internet Explorer, click Open.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>prompt to open or save the .rdp file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>prompt to open or save the .rdp file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the file is opened, the following security prompt appears:
trans-unit.target: When the file is opened, the following security prompt appears:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Windows security prompt</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Windows security prompt</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Connect, and a security prompt will appear for entering
trans-unit.target: Click Connect, and a security prompt will appear for entering

trans-unit.source: credentials to access the instance.
trans-unit.target: credentials to access the instance.

trans-unit.source: Enter the password you created
trans-unit.target: Enter the password you created

trans-unit.source: in Step 1[step 1: configure the service for remote desktop access using azure powershell], and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: in Step 1[step 1: configure the service for remote desktop access using azure powershell], and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>username/password prompt</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>username/password prompt</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the connection is made, Remote Desktop Connection displays the
trans-unit.target: When the connection is made, Remote Desktop Connection displays the

trans-unit.source: desktop of the instance in Azure.
trans-unit.target: desktop of the instance in Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Remote desktop session</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Remote desktop session</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Configure the service to disable Remote Desktop access
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Configure the service to disable Remote Desktop access

trans-unit.source: When you no longer require remote desktop connections to the role
trans-unit.target: When you no longer require remote desktop connections to the role

trans-unit.source: instances in the cloud, disable remote desktop access using [Azure PowerShell].
trans-unit.target: instances in the cloud, disable remote desktop access using [Azure PowerShell].

trans-unit.source: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet to publish the changes:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following PowerShell cmdlet to publish the changes:

trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.target: [Remotely Accessing Role Instances in Azure]
